DOC.brief_summary: This study is to investigate whether variants in the LOC387715 locus and the HtrA serine peptidase 1 (HTRA1) gene within the 10q26 locus are associated with polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy and whether they are associated with clinical patterns including angiographic phenotype in a Korean population.
DOC.brief_title: LOC387715/HTRA1 Variants in Polypoidal Choroidal Vasculopathy in a Korean Population
DOC.detailed_description: This is a cross-sectional case-control study. One hundred Korean patients with polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy and 100 control subjects were genotyped for the LOC387715 (rs10490924) and the HTRA1 gene polymorphism (rs11200638)
DOC.criteria: Polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy group patients older than 60 years of age at onset polyplike terminal aneurysmal dilations with or without branching vascular networks in indocyanine green angiography and subretinal reddishorange protrusions corresponding to polyplike lesions eyes with pathologic myopia, angioid streaks, central serous chorioretinopathy, and other retinal or choroidal diseases Control group individuals without retinal diseases and without any signs of polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy or agerelated macular degeneration on the bases of comprehensive ophthalmic examination results
